title: The Revolution Will Be Televised
description: If they had dripped those first three episodes of Andor Season 2 out, the community would be in crisis. I understand what they were trying to do, because some aspects of it get unfolded in the second three episode arc - which is excellent and is exactly what I want. But those first three feel mostly like setup, sawdust in the flour, because that's sorta what it is.
excerpt: Videogaming-related online strip by Mike Krahulik and Jerry Holkins. Includes news and commentary.
text: If they had dripped those first three episodes of Andor Season 2 out, the community would be in crisis. I understand what they were trying to do, because some aspects of it get unfolded in the second three episode arc - which is excellent and is exactly what I want. But those first three feel mostly like setup, sawdust in the flour, because that's sorta what it is. I would much prefer that they had started with these next three. Good Star Wars is a genuine rarity on Disney Plus, rare enough to hover over the cancel button for the service with real intention. I keep the subscription to mostly to watch older Marvel Stuff just to remember what it was like when it felt like there was a hand on the tiller. Gav just pulled the sheet off our new Pinny Arcade site, the only one in the family that doesn't have a hyphen in the name: pinnyarcade.com. Like its father, it is very handsome. By way of celebration, the first new piece of content over there is the Pin Quest for PAX East! Some super cool new partners whose pins I can't wait to buy. (CW)TB out.
html:
If they had dripped those first three episodes of Andor Season 2 out, the community would be in crisis. I understand what they were trying to do, because some aspects of it get unfolded in the second three episode arc - which is excellent and is exactly what I want. But those first three feel mostly like setup, sawdust in the flour, because that's sorta what it is.

I would much prefer that they had started with these next three. Good Star Wars is a genuine rarity on Disney Plus, rare enough to hover over the cancel button for the service with real intention. I keep the subscription to mostly to watch older Marvel Stuff just to remember what it was like when it felt like there was a hand on the tiller.

Gav just pulled the sheet off our new Pinny Arcade site, the only one in the family that doesn't have a hyphen in the name: pinnyarcade.com. Like its father, it is very handsome. By way of celebration, the first new piece of content over there is the Pin Quest for PAX East! Some super cool new partners whose pins I can't wait to buy.

(CW)TB out.
